intro: Reutera procumbens, commonly known as the prostrate reutera, is a low-growing shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in dense inflorescences. Reutera procumbens is adapted to thrive in coastal and rocky environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
